kentauros.instance package¶

Module contents¶

this module contains KtrInstance class that holds CLI and other status things, and, additionally, log, err, log_command functions for printing status msgs

class kentauros.instance.Kentauros(itype=<InstanceType.NORMAL: 0>)[source]¶

Bases: object

instance class with dict class variable, as a “Borg”, a quasi-singleton

saved_state = {}¶
kentauros.instance.dbg()[source]¶

prints debug messages if DEBUG is True set by –debug or by environment variable KTR_DEBUG=1

kentauros.instance.err()[source]¶

prints error messages to sys.stderr format: ERROR: <message>

kentauros.instance.log(msg, pri=2)[source]¶

kentauros.init.log(): prints log messages if “priority” is equal or less to verbosity level. priority levels mean (2 is the default): - 0: every message is printed and subprocesses are invoked with –verbose - 1: some messages are printed and subprocesses get no CLI flags - 2: few messages are printed and subprocesses are invoked with –quiet format: <message>

kentauros.instance.log_command(prefix1, basename, cmdlist, pri=2)[source]¶

kentauros.init.log_command(): prints commands that are executed using the subprocess module.
